qas.question: What is the English translation of the word Jeltoqsan?
Who was fired by Gorbachev causing riots?
What position did Konayev hold in Kazakhstan prior to his removal?

answers.text: First Secretary of the Communist Party

qas.question: Who took the place of Konayev?
When were the first demonstrations in Kazakhstan to protest the removal and replacement of Konayev?

context: The "Jeltoqsan" (Kazakh for "<a0_0>December<a0_0/>") of 1986 were riots in Alma-Ata, Kazakhstan, sparked by Gorbachev's dismissal of <a1_0>Dinmukhamed Konayev<a1_0/>, the <a2_0>First Secretary of the Communist Party<a2_0/> of Kazakhstan and an ethnic Kazakh, who was replaced with <a3_0>Gennady Kolbin<a3_0/>, an outsider from the Russian SFSR. Demonstrations started in the morning of <a4_0>December 17, 1986<a4_0/>, with 200 to 300 students in front of the Central Committee building on Brezhnev Square protesting Konayev's dismissal and replacement by a Russian. Protesters swelled to 1,000 to 5,000 as other students joined the crowd. The CPK Central Committee ordered troops from the Ministry of Internal Affairs, druzhiniki (volunteers), cadets, policemen, and the KGB to cordon the square and videotape the participants. The situation escalated around 5 p.m., as troops were ordered to disperse the protesters. Clashes between the security forces and the demonstrators continued throughout the night in Almaty.
